com.ashwin.fri.pacman.actor

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ashwin.fri.pacman.actor.Actor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ghost, PacMan

    public abstract class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
    Actors are the superclass of all movable objects in PacMan (aka PacMan and ghosts). Unlike Terrain, actors are not confined to a single tile. However, for the purposes of collisions, a center tile is computed based on the center of the sprite.
    Author:
    ashwin

      • Actor

        public Actor(java.awt.geom.Point2D pos,
     AnimatedSprite sprite,
     Actor.Orientation dir,
     double curSpeed)
        Parameters:
        grid - grid that the actor lives in
        maxSpeed - maximum possible speed for an actor
        speed - percentage of max speed that the Actor travels at
        sprite - the default sprite associated with the Actor
        initial - the initial TILE that the Actor begins on

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()

      • move

        public boolean move(java.util.List<Actor> actors,
           Grid grid)
        Moves the actor to its next location in the grid. The next position is specified by the getNextPosition method. The method returns true if the actor's position was changed by the move and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        game -
        Returns:
        whether or not the actor could move

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(Terrain terrain)
        Returns whether or not the actor can move through the specified terrain. By default, actors can only move through passable terrain. However, under certain circumstances actors can move through impassable terrain (ex. gates)
        Returns:
        whether or not the actor can move through the terrain

      • getInitialPosition

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D getInitialPosition()
        Returns the initial position of the actor. Used to reset the actor back to its original position.
        Returns:

      • getCurrentPosition

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D getCurrentPosition()
        The center Point2D of the actor. The tile that the center Point2D is in is used to determine collisions. Actors are allowed to take up more than just their own.
        Returns:
        center Point2D of the actor

      • getNextPosition

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D getNextPosition(Grid grid)
        The next position that the actor will go to on its next move. The actor will move a certain number of pixels determined by its speed and maxSpeed in the direction of its current orientation.
        Returns:
        next position of the actor

      • getInitialOrientation

        public Actor.Orientation getInitialOrientation()
        Returns the initial direction in which the actor was facing.
        Returns:

      • getCurrentOrientation

        public Actor.Orientation getCurrentOrientation()
        Returns the current direction in which the Actor is facing.
        Returns:
        the direction in which the actor is facing.

      • getNextOrientation

        public abstract Actor.Orientation getNextOrientation(java.util.List<Actor> actors,
                                   Grid grid)
        Returns the next direction that the actor will face once it reaches the midpoint of a tile.
        Returns:
        next orientation

      • getMoveCounter

        public int getMoveCounter()
        Get the number of moves that this Actor has performed since the last reset. This is used for timing purposes. Events occur after a certain number of move cycles.
        Returns:
        number of moves

      • setMoveCounter

        public void setMoveCounter(int moves)

      • getPixelSpeed

        public double getPixelSpeed()
        The current speed of the actor is defined as a percentage of its maxSpeed. During movement calculations the speed and max speed are multiplied together, but we treat them separately so that we can alter them independently.
        Returns:
        current speed (between 0.0 and 1.0)

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(double speed)

      • getSprite

        public AnimatedSprite getSprite()
        Returns the default sprite for this Actor. Subclasses can override the default behavior to implement different sprites for different states.
        Returns:
        default sprite
